articles.headline: WeWork C.E.O. Adam Neumann Steps Down Under Pressure
articles.snippet: The shake-up is the most significant step that the start-up, valued at nearly $50 billion at one point, has taken to win over Wall Street after a botched I.P.O.
articles.abstract: The shake-up is the most significant step that the start-up, valued at nearly $50 billion at one point, has taken to win over Wall Street after a botched I.P.O.
articles.lead_paragraph: Adam Neumann turned WeWork into one of the most valuable start-ups in the world largely through the force of his outsize personality. He persuaded investors to give him billions of dollars and employees to believe that the shared-office company was changing the world.
articles.byline: By David Gelles, Michael J. de la Merced, Peter Eavis and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: White House Seeks Deal for Whistle-Blower to Speak to Congress
articles.snippet: As House Democrats moved to begin a formal impeachment inquiry, the administration also prepared to release a redacted version of the whistle-blower’s complaint.
articles.abstract: As House Democrats moved to begin a formal impeachment inquiry, the administration also prepared to release a redacted version of the whistle-blower’s complaint.
articles.lead_paragraph: White House and intelligence officials were working out a plan on Tuesday to release a redacted version of the whistle-blower complaint that helped ignite the impeachment drive against President Trump and to allow the whistle-blower to speak with congressional investigators, people briefed on the matter said.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt, Julian E. Barnes and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Why an Impeachment Inquiry Now? Democrats Cite the Clarity of the Case
articles.snippet: After months of internal division over whether to begin a formal effort to oust President Trump, Democrats say his actions gave them no choice.
articles.abstract: After months of internal division over whether to begin a formal effort to oust President Trump, Democrats say his actions gave them no choice.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For months, dozens of House Democrats anxiously avoided even the mention of impeaching President Trump — right up until the moment that they demanded it.

articles.headline: Vox Media Acquires New York Magazine, Chronicler of the Highbrow and Lowbrow
articles.snippet: After more than 50 years and 44 National Magazine Awards, New York finds a home with a digital-media powerhouse.
articles.abstract: After more than 50 years and 44 National Magazine Awards, New York finds a home with a digital-media powerhouse.
articles.lead_paragraph: After more than 50 years of chronicling the highbrow, lowbrow, brilliant and despicable characters of the city whose name it took, New York Magazine has a new owner.
articles.byline: By Marc Tracy and Edmund Lee

articles.headline: Behind WeWork Leader’s Rise and Fall: A Wall St. Bank Playing Many Angles
articles.snippet: JPMorgan Chase, an ardent backer of the start-up and Adam Neumann, was as well placed as any investor to see his conflicts of interest.
articles.abstract: JPMorgan Chase, an ardent backer of the start-up and Adam Neumann, was as well placed as any investor to see his conflicts of interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: The ouster of WeWork’s co-founder and its botched initial public offering are a remarkable collapse of what was considered, up until weeks ago, one of the most valuable start-ups in the world.
